The DJ then joked: Look, I love you, I'm in your corner. I don't want the same thing to happen to you that happened to Regis[ Philbin]. The rivalry between the two late-night hosts stems from NBC's decision to hire Jay Leno to replace Johnny Carson on The Tonight Show in 1992, passing over David Letterman in the process. The replacement is more about streamlining operations at Google.`` Larry Page , Sergey Brin , and I spent a lot of time talking about how to run everything,'' Eric Schmidt said during the call. After a long series of conversations, we decided to make some changes in the way we are structured and the way we operate things. Historically, we've always been running the decisions together, and ultimately, it adds delay. This is exactly the opposite of how Larry Page described their respective roles in a href="http://googlesystem.blogspot.com/2011/01/googles-new-ceo-Larry Page-Larry Page.html"> 2004 SEC filing, when such collaboration helped`` facilitate timely decisions'' rather than cause`` delay'':

customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership to enhance Google's global reach.`` Eric Schmidt has clearly done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade,'' said Larry Page . The results speak for themselves. There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly. In addition, Google reported revenues of$ 8.44 billion for the fourth quarter of 2010. Providing Vermont and other states with the flexibility to build upon health care reform will result in better care and greater access at a lower cost. Allowing us to become a laboratory for innovation and excellence will help Vermonters, while once again allowing us to lead the way.
